website_summaries.verdict: The Onyx Boox Max2 is an impressively capable Android tablet with a 13.3-inch E Ink screen and a useful stylus...but it costs as much as an iPad Pro.
cons: Pen doesn't work well with third-party apps

customer_reviews.title: Best and cheapest e-ink monitor I have found. I no longer suffer from screen-triggered migraines.
customer_reviews.text: Simple to use as a monitor, which is what I mostly use it for. I no longer suffer from migraines due to too much scren time. E-ink is like looking at a newspaper: no harsh light to trigger strain, fatigue, and migraines. The refresh is quick enough that there is not the irritating lag of previous attempts at an e-ink monitor. It is even fast enough to watch video! Less buggy and less expensive than the Paperlike, of which I own three. This is my new goto device for when I want to spend more than fifteen minutes on my computer. Check out the review on Good Reads--it is what made me want to give this a try.
customer_reviews.author: Justin Sigars

customer_reviews.title: It's not that it's bad. It just lack of some functions for me
customer_reviews.text: I used it for two days and return it. It's not that it's bad. It just lack of some functions for me. Like I can't find the highlighting functions while taking notes and it does not have sentivity writing experience like remarkable. It also does not support 5 G hz wifi which is a little bit disappointed. Otherwise, it is pretty cool, you can customize your lock screen which is amazingly cool!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good product. BUT it’s a used one
customer_reviews.text: Good product. BUT it’s a used one. Someone named Douglas used it. And I can’t get rid off his calendar sittings.
customer_reviews.author: William

customer_reviews.title: Monitor is good, but resolution is fixed and very high
customer_reviews.text: Monitor is good, but resolution is fixed and very high. Display content is too small. As a display, can't change settings, contrast, brightness. Battery is too bad. It can only support 5 hours for reading with wifi. Wish new software can solve this. ---Append rate after one month usage Now display has a serious problem. It seems all display is moving downward. You can watch my video. The screen is not broken. Something wrong with display chip. I am contacting Onyx directly, because I just miss returning window. Onyx did not agree for return or replace it until now. Seems not a good customer service. If you like this one, please consider it carefully. It is not a mature product.
customer_reviews.author: Steven

customer_reviews.title: I just received this today, but it doesn't really ...
customer_reviews.text: I just received this today, but it doesn't really work... The most important issue is that the wifi does not work. It just says "Searching for Wi-Fi networks..." but sees no networks. I've tried rebooting a couple times. I tried resetting all network settings. Nothing works. I have lots of other devices here on the network. I tried to go to the onyx support web page, but it's a combination of Engilsh & Russian. I've emailed sales@onyx-international.com, which is what the support web site instructed. Hopefully someone responds quickly.
customer_reviews.author: J. S. Holmes

customer_reviews.title: Screen is too yellow with low contrast
customer_reviews.text: Pro: it delivers some of the nice features of a large e-ink tablet: light weight, hand writing notes, and native Android support. I can confirm that Mendeley works fine on this tablet. Con: The screen. Unlike Kindle which has white background, the screen of BOOX Max 2 is pretty much yellow. The characters are dark gray instead of being solid black. This gray on yellow screen leads to very low contrast (image the printing on a piece of old yellow news paper). Honestly, it may do more bad than good to your eyesight.
customer_reviews.author: HR

customer_reviews.title: The screen is way too dim for comfortable reading
customer_reviews.text: I was misled by positive reviews online, the sources of which I now wonder about. Very dim grey screen (put it next to a Kindle and it's like night and day), very difficult to highlight/edit documents in a easily visible manner, synching issues, weak wifi connectivity.
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: All the faults. Product description is good enough for successes
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to keep this thing so badly but the sorry comings were deal breakers. 1) monitor lag is too great 2) lack of front light means I can't read it when I'm ready to read, at night. 3) stylus is useless unless using their note app which is arguably unintuitive Less of an issue: (all were overcome) 4) buttons are placed in a very weird place 5) no customization of home screen, but even don't size? 6) no but I'm way to deliver personal library. 7) rotation is a shame 8) multiple cables when one cable can do it all, usb-c 9) no volume rocker 10) no lockscreen
customer_reviews.author: Clayton Dittman

customer_reviews.title: Great for reading PDFs
customer_reviews.text: Great for reading PDFs, or other full page documents with fixed formatting. It is large enough that it perfectly simulates a large paged book like a dictionary or printed academic journal. Scans or digital copies of large books are easy to read without zooming or scrolling. Contrast is good, and it makes a high resolution image, with text that is nearly as good as printed ink. It has Android, so you can basically do anything with it if you need to, but the screen refresh rate does make some tasks awkward. Overall it serves its purpose admirably, and has capabilities its competition lacks, making it the best choice available for many use cases.
customer_reviews.author: John S.

customer_reviews.title: Screen defect
customer_reviews.text: I loved it, until it’s screen just suddenly froze after just two weeks of use. I’ve tried everything: recharging it, resetting it, nothing works. I’ve emailed onyx customer support. I guess I’ll see how it goes, but I’m not getting my hopes high as even if repair is offered, international shipping is usually problematic. I did some more research and apparently screen quality issues are quite common with these.

Compared to the SONY dpt-r1, the only advantage is that it does not need to connect to the computer. But now I regret that I hadn't bought two dpt-r1 but tried this e-reader.

customer_reviews.title: Works best for reading docs/email as extended monitor
customer_reviews.text: Works good for text only reading. I only use it as an extension monitor because I read a lot of emails and review lots of documents. Doesn't work well for reviewing drawings. Due to the refresh rate it takes time to move the mouse around so for that application it doesn't work well. Very good at reducing eye strain. I also don't use the note taking aspect but it writes well, I'm just worried to loose battery in the middle of a meeting while taking notes. I downloaded Google drive to share docs between devices, works well.

customer_reviews.title: button

customer_reviews.author: Enyi Zhu

customer_reviews.title: If you do any reading or writing, Onyx Max2 is for you.
customer_reviews.text: Big screen, outdoor use, incredible readability! The Onyx Max2 gives new life to paper. I only can count myself as lucky living in an age and at a time in my life where this technology has made a difference in my life. Lots to read with e-ink ease, no more flying sheets of music with drafts or outdoors, impromptu notes and easy reading in direct sunlight, a lightness that is a perfect complement to the huge screen, and not having to worry about sucky battery life like those other backlight tablets. The Onyx Max2 fills a void that no other tablet can satisfy to-date.
customer_reviews.author: Hawaiian Kava

customer_reviews.title: Kindle App seems to have trouble
customer_reviews.text: I edit a journal, so i download manuscripts 2x weekly to read on the Max2, and it works fine for that. I loaded some books for Kindle, and it works okay. The go to feature, and the menu for making changes are not where they are on a kindle. I try all sorts of things, and every once in awhile the menu appears, and you can make some changes to it. customer_reviews.title: It's great! exactly what I am looking for for years

customer_reviews.title: Works well as a secondary monitor. Onyx has to work on improving contrast of text.
customer_reviews.text: This device works well as a secondary monitor but Onyx still has to do a lot of work ahead (specifically around improving the contrast of text). Looks like this display is tuned towards photos and videos. Therefore, you get realistic photos and videos however it takes a toll on the reading experience. Most users buy this device to read TEXT (and not videos, pics), Onyx need to improve contrast of text when the screen is mirrored as an extended monitor.

customer_reviews.title: Amazingly useful
customer_reviews.text: The device is very useful for my college courses. I take notes, enter Excel data and read textbooks with ease.

customer_reviews.title: Distinctly Inferior Handwriting
customer_reviews.text: This e-ink reader is marketed as a professional note taking tool. It has many nice features, but it fails in the most fundamental task: handwriting with the stylus. The trace lags the stylus nib very noticeably, and there is an objectionable offset between the nib and the trace. If you have experienced handwriting with the Apple Pencil on the iPad Pro you will be highly disappointed with the Boox Max 2. Too bad! I was hoping for a great handwriting experience on a device with an e-ink screen, but this one just does not live up to the advertising.

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended for those who like to read scientific or engineering ...
customer_reviews.text: Highly recommended for those who like to read scientific or engineering technical books in pdf like me. You no longer need to be bothered with zooming,cropping your pdf due to the device size. For page flipping, you can always switch it to A2 mode(you can customise touch setting of neoreader for A2 mode switching), which will give you fast response(I can flip through 100 pages within 1 minute), and after you locate your page, switch back to normal mode for text quality. If you only do reading, without WiFi turned on, battery lasts very long(1% battery consumption can last>30 minutes). Hesitate no more if you can afford.

product_meta.title: BOOX Max2 Ereader,Android 6.0 32 GB,13.3" Dual-Touch HD Display
feature_bullets: Stable Android 6.0: Compare with our older version of ereader and other ebook readers,Max 2 will run much more faster with 1.6G Quad-core CPU than ever before.
Dual Touch Control : Electromagnetic touch control with electromagnetic pen (Wacom stylus) for scribbling, and capacitive touch with finger for free reading
Side Note View : You can have an EPUB or MOBI open on one side of the screen and the note app on the other. This will allow you to jot down notes on each page and save them
4096 Degrees of Pressure Sensitivity :Max 2 will let you get thicker or thinner lines by pressing on the screen and gives you a chance to draw or write down your inspiration
